member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.AsyncDelegateCommand
member.summary: Provides an implementation which relays the and method to the specified delegates. This implementation disables the command during the async command execution.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.exception: The execute argument must not be null.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile
member.summary: Represents a recent file.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile.#ctor
member.summary: This constructor overload is reserved and should not be used. It is used internally by the XmlSerializer.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The file path.
member.exception: The argument path must not be null or empty.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile.IsPinned
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this recent file is pinned.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile.Path
member.summary: Gets the file path.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList
member.summary: This class encapsulates the logic for a recent file list.
member.remarks: This class can be used in a Settings file to store and load the recent file list as user settings. In Visual Studio you might need to enter the full class name "System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList" in the "Select a type" dialog.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.RecentFiles
member.summary: Gets the list of recent files.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.MaxFilesNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of recent files in the list.
member.remarks: If the set number is lower than the list count then the recent file list is truncated to the number.
member.exception: The value must be equal or larger than 1.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.Load(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile})
member.summary: Loads the specified collection into the recent file list. Use this method when you need to initialize the RecentFileList manually. This can be useful when you are using an own persistence implementation.
member.remarks: Recent file items that exist before the Load method is called are removed.
member.param: The recent files.
member.exception: The argument recentFiles must not be null.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.AddFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a file to the recent file list. If the file already exists in the list then it only changes the position in the list.
member.param: The path of the recent file.
member.exception: The argument fileName must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Applications.RecentFileList.Remove(System.Waf.Applications.RecentFile)
member.summary: Removes the specified recent file.
member.param: The recent file to remove.
member.exception: The argument recentFile must not be null.
The argument recentFile was not found in the recent files list.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Applications.ViewModelCore`1
member.summary: Abstract base class for a ViewModel implementation with a simple approach to set the DataContext.
member.typeparam: The type of the view. Do provide an interface as type and not the concrete type itself.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and attaches itself as DataContext to the view.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and attaches itself as DataContext to the view.
member.param: The view.
If set to true then the DataContext of the view is set within this constructor call. Default is true.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.ViewModelCore`1.View
member.summary: Gets the associated view.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Applications.ViewModelCore`1.ViewCore
member.summary: Gets the associated view as specified view type.
member.remarks: Use this property in a ViewModel class to avoid casting.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Foundation.SynchronizingCollectionCore`2
member.summary: Represents a collection that synchronizes all of it's items with the items of the specified original collection. When the original collection notifies a change via the interface then this collection synchronizes it's own items with the original items.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the collection.
The type of elements in the original collection.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.SynchronizingCollectionCore`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`1},System.Func{`1,`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The original collection.
The factory which is used to create new elements in this collection.
member.exception: The argument originalCollection must not be null.
The argument factory must not be null.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The original collection.
The factory which is used to create new elements in this collection.
Pass true when the subclass takes care about the collection changed event of the originalCollection. Default is false.
member.exception: The argument originalCollection must not be null.
The argument factory must not be null.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.SynchronizingCollectionCore`2.OriginalCollectionChanged(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Call this method when the orignal collection has changed.

The event args of the collection changed event.
member.exception: Argument e must not be null.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.SynchronizingCollectionCore`2.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method from a subclass when you implement a finalizer (destructor).

member.summary: Override this method to free, release or reset any resources.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Foundation.IReadOnlyObservableList`1
member.summary: Represents a read-only list of elements that can be accessed by index. Additional the list notifies listeners of changes, such as when items get added and removed.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the read-only list. This type parameter is covariant. That is, you can use either the type you specified or any type that is more derived.

member.summary: Occurs when a property value changes.

member.summary: Set the property with the specified value. If the value is not equal with the field then the field is set, a PropertyChanged event is raised and it returns true.

member.returns: True if the value has changed, false if the old and new value were equal.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledActionMode
member.summary: Defines the throttling mode.

member.name: F:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledActionMode.InvokeMaxEveryDelayTime
member.summary: Invokes the method at maximum once for the delay time.

member.name: F:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledActionMode.InvokeOnlyIfIdleForDelayTime
member.summary: Invokes the method only if no invoke request was called for duration of the delay time.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction
member.summary: This class supports throttling of multiple method calls to improve the responsiveness of an application. It delays a method call and skips all additional calls of this method during the delay. The call of the action is synchronized. It uses the current synchronization context that was active during creating this class.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction.#ctor(System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The action that should be throttled.
member.exception: The argument action must not be null.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction.#ctor(System.Action,System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledActionMode,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The action that should be throttled.
Defines the throttling mode.
The delay time.
member.exception: The argument action must not be null.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction.IsRunning
member.summary: Indicates that an execution of the action delegate is requested.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction.InvokeAccumulated
member.summary: Requests the execution of the action delegate.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ThrottledAction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the execution of the action delegate that was requested.

member.name: T:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel
member.summary: Defines a base class for a model that supports validation.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.HasErrors
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the entity has validation errors.

member.name: E:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.ErrorsChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the validation errors have changed for a property or for the entire entity.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.GetErrors
member.summary: Gets the validation errors for the entire entity.
member.returns: The validation errors for the entity.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.GetErrors(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the validation errors for a specified property or for the entire entity.
member.param: The name of the property to retrieve validation errors for; or null or String.Empty, to retrieve entity-level errors.
member.returns: The validation errors for the property or entity.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.Validate
member.summary: Validates the object and all its properties. The validation results are stored and can be retrieved by the GetErrors method. If the validation results are changing then the ErrorsChanged event will be raised.
member.returns: True if the object is valid, otherwise false.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.SetPropertyAndValidate``1(``0@,``0,System.String)
member.summary: Set the property with the specified value and validate the property. If the value is not equal with the field then the field is set, a PropertyChanged event is raised, the property is validated and it returns true.
member.param: Reference to the backing field of the property.
The new value for the property.
The property name. This optional parameter can be skipped because the compiler is able to create it automatically.
member.returns: True if the value has changed, false if the old and new value were equal.
member.exception: The argument propertyName must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:System.Waf.Foundation.ValidatableModel.OnErrorsChanged(System.ComponentModel.DataErrorsChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
